title: Double space is back in firefox for me firefox 99.0
content:
There is a specific challenge that i am facing with Firefox and some of the solutions that i have tried is not helping me to resolve the issue.

What's the issue: There are double spaces issue in Firefox

Where is it : 1) Menu 1.1) It's in the Menu New Tab is seen to me as New Tab (more spaces are for demonstration only) 1.2) All the Menu items which have space are show with more then one space including 

  1.2.1) File Menu -> New   Window (and all the drop down menus with spaces)   1.2.2) Edit Menu -> Select     All (and all the drop down menus with spaces)   1.2.3) View-> Page     Style (and all the drop down menus with spaces)    1.2.4) All the rest of the menus where ever there is a space there is a double space

2) URL : I type something in the URL and they are double spaced "this is test" will look like "this is test" 

   THIS URL looks to be double spaced on firefox https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1338204?page=2    like below

3) Numbers in the browser : 

   Any number displayed is double spaced in the browser output (most of the times, most of the web pages)

4) Bookmarks : All bookmarks are double spaced

5) Settings:

Settings: I have tried some suggestions below and they did not work for me.

browser.proton.contextmenus.enabled browser.proton.contextmenus.enabled is still set to false but seems to have no effect toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets=true browser.proton.contextmenus.enabled=false


6) Reference: I have tried some suggestions below and they did not work for me. 

 https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1350754  https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1186601  https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1338204?page=2  https://superuser.com/questions/1654597/firefox-menus-became-double-spaced-in-latest-update-i-want-to-return-to-single
creator: pnatraj

title: mozilla slow to start
content: After recent latest update 99.0.1 Mozilla is slow to start. It seems to hang. I use Google as my homepage. Am Windows 7, 64 bit. I tried refresh and made Mozilla my home page. No difference. Chrome opens fine. Was really disappointed with refresh. It dropped a number of icons for shortcuts on my desktop - ????? which were a real pain to replace because making shortcuts with Mozilla is not possible without changing the User Account Control setting in Control Panel which I was unaware of but found after searching for 1/2 hour. I have no idea when this changed nor why it did on the Mozilla side because I have been using Windows 7 for 12 years. I am sending this using Chrome as my browser.

title: Firefox endlessly creates instances in the Volume Mixer for Windows 10 Systems.
content:
This has happened for so long and is what is keeping me from using Firefox, making me want to uninstall it sometimes.

Most people don't leave their Volume Mixer open, but some do, and I rely on it quite a lot. Wasn't too much of an issue because it only happened when I used Firefox. Recently.. Starting some several months ago maybe even a year. Firefox will now create instances in the Mixer even without launching it. I haven't used it in weeks and yet every day there's more instances in my mixer.

title: mozilla folder completely missing from appdata/roaming
content: last night i reset firefox in order to fix a software error. all of my data is still connected to the browser and i have no problem opening my installed addons and bookmarks. my profile folder is completely missing. i tried to open it from the open folder button in about:profiles and about:config pages. i got the same exact location is missing error message every time. i went into my appdata folder and checked local, locallow and roaming. there was only one mozilla folder in locallow and it was completely empty. about:profiles says that my current profile, the default release one, is currently in use, but it isn't on my computer. there's not even an old data folder like some articles suggested. i haven't deleted or fiddled with anything since the reset. nothing is in my recycling bin. i've reread every article at least three times and none of them have solutions i can use because the mozilla folder is COMPLETELY MISSING.

title: Firefox, what have you done??  All my bookmarks have disappeared!  17 April, 2022.
content:
What have you done, Firefox? Where are my bookmarks? None of the help articles have helped me find them. No "Bookmarks Library" link, no bookmarks button on main page, no "Refresh" option anywhere that I can find....

Opened Firefox this morning around 11 a.m., opened up Firefox. A dialogue box I have never seen before appeared, insisting I set up a "profile". What profile? Why? Why no explanation of why I need a profile, and what the h.... is the difference between the two profiles offered?

When I finally chose "default" for profile (NO idea what that means!), I saw that all my settings are gone and most alarmingly, ALL my bookmarks. HOW do I retrieve them?

I am using a laptop Dell with Windows 10, 64-bit....what else do you need to know?

Really upset with this. Also upset with how difficult it is to find immediate help for Firefox.

AFB.

title: When is Firefox going to stop being so inefficient and such a resource hog?
content:
Websites that run fine on Safari will consume RIDICULOUS amount of CPU time when open in tabs on Firefox. This is NOT a website issue. This is a FIREFOX issue. Doing a little bit of searching on the internet, this has apparently been an ONGOING problem for FIREFOX.

I am tired of all the "possible" explanations, especially after ruling them out.

NO, it's NOT "add-on" or extensions. NO, it's NOT "preferences." NO, it's NOT "the website."

IT IS FIREFOX.

I am ready to PERMANENTLY DELETE Firefox—just like I did with Chrome—and NEVER look back.

Sad. I remember the days when Firefox was my only browser.

Too bad it's developers seem (really) inept.
creator: brian.ansorge

title: eMail program fails at final step with "500 Something went Wrong" error
content: Windows 8.1, Firefox 99.0.2, eMail program part of Microsoft Office365 (deployed by university IT department) Login process worked fine for a month or so after implementation of a 2-level authentication (password plus a second method of user's choice - I chose a USB-flash device which [on request] sends a code for 2nd verification). All of the above still works, except that once logged in, the system asks me if it should remember me, or not (i.e., store a cookie or not, for future convenience). I always click "No". Now, when I do that, I get an error number 500, which is completely non-committal: "Something Went Wrong" - with a long garbage code. (See attachment for sample.) Results of tests to see what's wrong: 1) works fine (able to complete eMail login) under Microsoft Edge; 2) works fine on my laptop, running Windows 8.1 and Firefox 94; 3) on the 'problem' computer (desktop), I uninstalled Firefox 99 and downloaded/installed Firefox 93 - "500" error persisted. Just today: removed Firefox/Mozilla (including all folders/files, and Registry entries) then re-installed version 99. Still doesn't work. Let me know what else you need to know.
creator: hawked-off
